channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Fire sparks evacuation of Westfield shopping centre
item.description: Shoppers have been evacuated from an east London shopping centre after a fire broke out inside one of the stores. Around 40 firefighters and eight engines rushed to Westfield in Stratford.

item.title: Up to 17 Christian missionaries along with their families are kidnapped by gang members in Haiti
item.description: As many as 17 Christian Missionaries from the United States have been kidnapped by a gang on Saturday in Port-au-Prince as they were on a bus heading to the airport.

item.title: 'I'll knock you the f**k out': Passengers jump to woman's defence after thug tries to attack her
item.description: A video shared online shows the man hurling abuse and threats at a young woman onboard a central line train on Friday night before he squares up to her and passengers jump to her defence.

item.title: China fires hypersonic missile to circle planet in low orbit in terrifying display of its weaponry
item.description: China has tested a nuclear-capable hypersonic missile in August, showing a capability that caught U.S. intelligence by surprise.

item.title: Sir David Amess murder: Cops raid 'childhood home' of terror suspect Ali Harbi Ali
item.description: Police searched the home in a quiet street in Croydon, south London, on Friday. A neighbour today told MailOnline how Ali grew up in the terrace property before leaving in his late teens.

item.title: Russian moviemakers return to Earth after 12 days spent filming on the International Space Station
item.description: Russian filmmakers Yulia Peresild and Klim Shipenko returned to Earth early this morning, following a 12-day stint in space filming scenes for upcoming movie 'The Challenge'.

item.title: BLM-inspired lessons about 'white privilege' launched at £19,000-a-year London private school
item.description: Pupils at St Dunstan's College, Catford, southeast London, are being taught about 'white privilege'. The curriculum also asks why all British Prime Ministers so far have been white.

item.title: Billy Porter takes credit for men wearing skirts and dresses and embracing non-binary fashion
item.description: Last November, Harry, 27, made history as the first solo male cover star of US Vogue in its 127 years, in a shoot which saw him wear a Gucci dress and feminine garments.

item.title: Horse trader who kept 171 animals in 'disgraceful' conditions on squalid farm jailed for 19 weeks
item.description: Geoffrey Bennett, 67, from Surrey, kept alpacas, horses, goats, dogs and birds living in cramped and filthy conditions. He has been jailed for 19 weeks.

item.title: Midsomer Murders viewers warned over 'offensive' Morris Dancers
item.description: TV censors at streaming service BritBox have warned viewers the season two episode Blood Will Out (right), 'includes traditional dancing that might offend some viewers.'

item.title: Sir Paul McCartney opens up about the 'hurtful' Beatles break-up
item.description: Sir Paul McCartney, 79, has opened about the break-up of the Beatles, which he compared to a 'divorce' in his upcoming book The Lyrics: 1956, which is to be published on November 2.

item.title: Sir David Amess reported 'upsetting' threat to the police just days before he was knifed to death
item.description: The threat was reported to Essex Police, but the Conservative MP decided to go ahead with the surgery at Belfairs Methodist Church in Leigh-on-Sea on Friday before being fatally stabbed.

item.title: Teenage boy, 17, is charged with murder after man, 33, was stabbed to death in a playing field
item.description: A 17-year-old from London who stabbed a man in a field in Swindon last weekend has today been charged with murder. Lee Turner, 33, was found dead from a single stab wound last Sunday.

item.title: Relationship experte reveals how you can forgive someone who's cheated
item.description: Speaking exclusively to FEMAIL, Dr Carmen Harra advised on how to avoid getting 'stuck' in hurtful memories and how allowing yourself to feel angry is the best way to find your inner calm,

item.title: Gareth Bale's agent says the Welshman and Jose Mourinho 'didn't see football the same way'
item.description: Bale made just six Premier League starts last term under Jose Mourinho, with the player's representative Jonathan Barnett admitting: 'Let's just say it wasn't the best return to a club in history.'

item.title: Vanessa Bryant asked to undergo psychiatric exam to evaluate 'emotional injuries' from crash pix
item.description: L.A. County attorneys have requested Vanessa undergo a psych evaluation to prove her alleged distress, a request the star may be forced to oblige 'via a judge's ruling if need be.'

item.title: Leigh-Anne Pinnock tears up at her 30th birthday party following Jesy Nelson row
item.description: The singer became emotional as she was supported by her fiancé Andre Gray, 30, following her 'blackfishing' row with former Little Mix bandmate Jesy Nelson and rapper Nicki Minaj.

item.title: Succession star Sarah Snook secretly MARRIES comedian Dave Lawson
item.description: The Australian actress, who stars on the smash hit HBO series Succession , fell for her fellow Aussie while the pals were locked down together.

item.title: Elvis Presley's drummer Ronnie Tutt dies aged 83 as Graceland bosses pay heartfelt tribute
item.description: Elvis Presley's drummer, Ronnie Tutt, has died aged 83, with bosses from the singer's Graceland estate paying tribute to the musician.

item.title: Prevent programme will be reviewed to see if it is 'fit for purpose', says Priti Patel
item.description: Priti Patel says the programme is undergoing an independent review that will 'address any gaps' in the wake of the terror attack which resulted in the death of Southend MP Sir David Amess

item.title: Police or private guards will protect MPs at weekly surgeries in wake of the murder of David Amess
item.description: Priti Patel said it would be unacceptable for the murder of Tory veteran David Amess to 'break the link between an elected representative and their democratic role'.

item.title: Adorable clip of Elephant making a mess while eating a cake goes viral
item.description: The video of a baby elephant destroying a cake in a Thai sanctuary where he was staying with his grandmother. The clip shows the baby stepping and sitting on the cake, before spitting it out.

item.title: Over 200 academics call out 'trans activist bullies' in letter of support for feminist professor
item.description: The letter, signed by some of the UK's leading academics, follows months of heated debate about gender on university campuses, including a masked protest urging one professor to resign .

item.title: DAN HODGES: The visceral hatred of Tories at the heart of Labour has to end right now
item.description: DAN HODGES: As David Amess left our last meeting, he asked about my mother - the former Labour MP for Hampstead & Highgate - with whom he used to spar across the Commons chamber.

item.title: Treasury 'warns of diminishing returns from green investment'
item.description: A leaked briefing ahead of the COP26 summit says the spending needed to achieve Net Zero was 'uncertain', although it could help improve the UK's lagging productivity levels.

item.title: Cocaine crisis in the elderly: NHS is treating patients as old as NINETY for Class A abuse
item.description: New figures reveal a cocaine crisis in England's elderly population, with a 518 percent increase in hospitalisations of over-60s due to 'extreme use' of the Class A drug over the last ten years.

item.title: Biker, 24, who left pensioner, 71, in a coma after crashing into him and doing wheelies is jailed
item.description: Nicholas Marshall, 24, left a pensioner in a coma for over a month by crashing into him while performing wheelies at a tram stop in Clifton, Nottingham while high on cannabis. He has been jailed for 16 months.

item.title: Priti Patel says making Southend city would be a 'wonderful tribute' to David Amess
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel pointed to the two-decade campaign by David Amess, recalling the way he raised the issue at every opportunity in the Commons.

item.title: Husband of murdered MP Jo Cox tells of moment he learned about fatal stabbing of Sir David Amess
item.description: Brendan Cox said his reaction to hearing the news of Sir David Amess's death was 'immediate and physical' and that he has reached out to the late MP's family to offer his support.

item.title: Young humpback whale entangled in a shark net is freed off Sydney coast
item.description: The juvenile humpback whale got into trouble about 800m off Whale Beach, on Sydney's northern beaches, and was freed in a four-and-a-half hour rescue after a beachgoer spotted it.

item.title: Social media giants must do MORE to protect MPs from 'deluge of abuse', demands ex-digital minister
item.description: Conservative MP David Warman urged social media companies to make it increasingly difficult for social media users to hide behind anonymous profiles and abuse politicians online.

item.title: How to plan meals for three months in just 15 minutes
item.description: Food writer Amy Sheppard, 41, from Cornwall, has explained how to slash the cost of your groceries by up to 40 per cent and saving time in the process.

item.title: The Queen is looking for a £11,300-a-year cleaner for Buckingham Palace
item.description: The job advertises either 20 or 40 hours of work per week, Monday to Sunday, paying £11,300 to £22,600 depending on hours at the London home of the monarch.

item.title: Petra Ecclestone is selling 20,000 sq ft Grade II-listed £170M home 'off-market'
item.description: In a new clip, produced by Architectural Digest, mother-of-four Petra and Sam introduce people to their Grade II listed home, Chelsea which has been transformed into a palace of gold and crystal.

item.title: Haunting video of David Amess discussing impact of being an MP on loved ones is revealed
item.description: In the clip, which was filmed 10 years ago, Sir David, who was killed on Friday, says he has 'no doubt' that his family pay a big price for his service as an MP and that it was 'very, very tough'.

item.title: DC Comics ditch mention of 'The American Way' from Superman's motto
item.description: DC Comics announced a departure from Superman's longstanding motto 'Truth, Justice and the American Way' on Saturday and replaced the patriotic portion with 'a Better Tomorrow.'

item.title: British grandma jailed for smuggling cocaine on cruise dies in agony in Portuguese rat-infested jail
item.description: Retired secretary Susan Clarke died in Lisbon's EP Tires jail last Sunday, where she had been held for two years after being caught smuggling cocaine on a cruise with husband Roger, 72.

item.title: GPs and patients complain about Covid-19 booster jab chaos
item.description: Last week the Mail on Sunday revealed thousands of vulnerable patients from across Britain are having difficulties in securing a Covid booster shot. This week they tell their stories.

item.title: French fishermen threaten Channel blockade after EU snubs Macron
item.description: Paris was infuriated when Jersey only granted licences to 12 small French boats out of 47 applications this summer - saying they had failed to provide evidence they were entitled.

item.title: Terrifying footage of moment Jonathan Goodwin America Got Talent stuntman almost died hit by cars
item.description: Jonathan Goodwin was performing a stunt on America's Got Talent: Extreme filmed in Atlanta. He was being suspended between two elevated cars between which he was supposed to fall.

item.title: Prince Charles says he's 'very proud' of son William for for 'his growing commitment to environment'
item.description: Taking to Instagram, the Prince of Wales, 72, praised his eldest son, 39, for his 'growing commitment to the environment and the bold ambition of the Earthshot Prize'.

item.title: Melanoma Australia: Meabh Feerick criticises Irish health system over terminal skin cancer care
item.description: Terminally ill Meabh Feerick, 25, believes she is 'losing time' after returning to Ireland and its shambolic health system. The mum-of-one says she was better off in Australia.

item.title: The $32 'optical illusion' dress that makes your waist look instantly smaller
item.description: A woman has caught the attention of millions on social media after sharing a video wearing an 'optical illusion' dress that made her waist look instantly smaller than it actually is.

item.title: Strictly fans go wild as they're convinced Adam Peaty and Katya Jones 'nearly KISS'
item.description: Strictly Come Dancing fans were sent wild on Saturday night as they were convinced that Adam Peaty and Katya Jones 'nearly kissed' at the end of their racy Argentine Tango.

item.title: I'd rather go on holiday with Boris Johnson than Keir Starmer, say voters
item.description: Boris Johnson comes out top when voters are asked who they prefer to be Prime Minister, by 42 per cent to 33 per cent; and while 47 per cent of voters think Mr Johnson would be best to go for a drink.

item.title: China's real-life Squid Game: Organs harvested from 100,000 political dissidents and prisoners
item.description: China's Communist Party removes hearts, kidneys, livers and corneas from 100,000 dissidents and political prisoners every year, with a government-run 'kill to order' organ-trafficking network.

item.title: Little Mix to 'formally announce they are SPLITTING UP next month'
item.description: Little Mix are reportedly set to announce next month that they are formally splitting up, amid speculation they are planning solo careers.

item.title: Susan Sarandon reveals she had a final phone call with ex-lover David Bowie a week before he died
item.description: The Thelma & Louise actress has revealed how she rekindled her friendship with her former lover in the months before he died.

item.title: Freddy Krueger's razor glove from A Nightmare On Elm Street go up for auction in £5.5million sale
item.description: Freddy Krueger's razor glove from A Nightmare On Elm Street is expected to raise about £30k in an auction next month and the helmet worn by Russell Crowe in Gladiator is expected to fetch £50k.

item.title: Doctor who 'botched three major gallbladder operations in five days' is STILL working for the NHS
item.description: Camilo Valero, a consultant general surgeon, has been working at the Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals Trust for the past 21 months, despite watchdog investigation.

item.title: Hair is the BBC news! Presenters rejoice as they get their stylists back after 18 months
item.description: BBC Worldwide newsreader Karin Giannone revealed her joy at the stylists' return in a tweet she shared with her 30,000 followers last week. 'No more DIY!' she tweeted.

item.title: Knifeman stabs boy, 14, to death at Glasgow railway station
item.description: Emergency services were called to Glasgow's High Street station and the boy was taken by ambulance to the city's Queen Elizabeth University Hospital where he was later pronounced dead.

item.title: How chatting to your cat can make a purrfect pal (and what each of their 'meows' means)
item.description: Understanding the meaning behind every meow, blink or tail-twitch is crucial to making them feel safe and secure at home, experts say.

item.title: SARAH VINE: Abuse of MPs and their families is a modern blood sport
item.description: SARAH VINE: By all accounts, Sir David Amess was the gentlest and kindest of men - a veteran public servant who dedicated his life to his constituents.

item.title: Prince Charles, Diana and the boys on holiday in Majorca (as imagined by The Crown)
item.description: Our exclusive pictures show the couple - played by Dominic West and Elizabeth Debicki - frolicking in the Spanish surf with their beloved sons.

item.title: Thousands of children miss out on vital reading books as schools face delivery delays
item.description: Primary schools are still waiting for phonics books for pupils aged between four and eight, which should have arrived for the start of the academic year but might not be available until after half-term.

item.title: STEPHEN ADAMS: Three reasons not to panic over Britain's Covid infection rate
item.description: STEPHEN ADAMS: Ministers are quietly confident that this winter will be nothing like as bad as last, despite persistently high infection rates.

item.title: NASA's Lucy mission launches and will swing past eight different asteroids during 12-year journey
item.description: A nearly billion dollar NASA spacecraft named Lucy officially launched on Saturday morning, in what is the beginning of a 12-year journey to explore eight different asteroids, according to NASA.

item.title: How the Palace threatened to cut me dead if I revealed the Queen breastfed Prince Charles
item.description: It was 1979 and I had just completed the first of my trilogy of biographies of Prince Charles. Just one potentially awkward ritual remained before I could give my publisher the finished manuscript.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: We're in the Age of the Curfew - and there's no escape
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: Prepare to be confined to your home again. Prepare to be prevented from working and put on a state dole. Prepare to have your education trashed.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: Why there's no shame in being treated for depression
item.description: Dr Ellie Cannon appeared on This Morning during the week to tell Holly and Phil about her experiences taking anti-depressants and why there is no shame in seeking help.

item.title: Caribbean: The joys of relaxing in Antigua with a private chef who has cooked for Eric Clapton
item.description: Claudia Joseph checked into Villa Azura near Long Bay. Highlights of her stay included learning how to make a traditional Antiguan breakfast and snorkelling among southern stingrays.
